meanings.definition: Confined to bed due to illness or disability.
meanings.sent1: The bedfast patient was unable to move around freely.
meanings.sent2: She felt bedfast after her surgery and needed help getting up.
meanings.sent3: The bedfast cat refused to leave its cozy spot on the bed.
meanings.sent4: His mind felt as bedfast as his body, trapped in a cycle of negative thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The image of the bedfast man lying in the hospital bed was etched in her memory.

meanings.sent1: Being bedfast for days made her appreciate the freedom of movement.
meanings.sent2: The bedfast child watched cartoons from the comfort of his bed.
meanings.sent3: The bedfast teddy bear was propped up against the pillows, keeping watch over the room.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt bedfast with worry, unable to shake off the anxiety.
meanings.sent5: The bedfast old dog wagged its tail happily whenever someone approached.

meanings.definition: Restricted to or confined to bed.
meanings.sent1: The bedfast grandmother enjoyed reading books to pass the time.
meanings.sent2: He felt bedfast but tried to stay positive by listening to music.
meanings.sent3: The bedfast robot beeped sadly, unable to join the others in the yard.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams felt bedfast, limited by the boundaries of her own fears.
meanings.sent5: The bedfast tree stood tall in the garden, its roots firmly planted in the ground.
